description: Instantiates an auto-scaling virtual server based on the selected file transfer protocol in AWS.
mitreAttackTechniques: T1537 - Transfer Data to Cloud Account

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: The server creation process may involve generating or utilizing valid credentials, which can be leveraged by attackers to gain unauthorized access to the system.
The server can be used to facilitate command and control communications using standard file transfer protocols (e.g., SFTP, FTPS), which are application layer protocols.
Attackers could configure the server to allow them to access from the internet to S3 files.

incidents.description: Muddled Libra’s Evolution to the Cloud

securityImplications: Attackers might use CreateServer to create a server that allows to transfer files into and out of AWS storage services.

simulation.value: aws transfer create-server --protocols SFTP --endpoint-type PUBLIC --identity-provider-type SERVICE_MANAGED
